title: Hong Kong's 99-Year Lease
description: A micro-lesson that makes Hong Kong's 99-Year Lease usable.

hook.text: In 1898, Britain leased Hong Kong's New Territories from China for 99 years. The clock started ticking.

buildup.text: Hong Kong grew into one of the world's greatest financial centers under British administration.

discovery.text: As 1997 approached, banks refused to issue mortgages extending past the lease expiration.

climax.text: On July 1, 1997, the lease expired and Hong Kong returned to China, ending 156 years of British control.
